clinical_study.brief_title: The Influence of Angiotensin Converting Enzyme Inhibitors and Angiotensin Receptor Blockers on Renal Function in Patients Undergoing Non-emergent Coronary Angiography

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the current study is to evaluate prospectively whether concomitant administration of RAAS blockers (namely ACE-I and ARBs') influence the change in estimated GFR (eGFR) after administration of contrast media in patients undergoing non-emergent coronary angiography.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in eGFR from baseline to 48 hours following the exposure to the contrast.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 48 hours after exposure to the contrast

secondary_outcome.measure: 1. Rate of eGFR decrease>25% from the baseline, 2. Length of hospitalization,

arm_group.arm_group_label: continue ace-i and arb's versus dicontinue

intervention.intervention_name: stop ace-i/arb 24 h before procedure and restarted 24 hours after the procedure
intervention.description: ACE/ARB stopped 24 hours prior to the procedure and restarted 24 hours after the procedure

intervention.intervention_name: ACE/ARB stopped 24 hours before procedure and start immediately after
intervention.description: ACE/ARB stopped 24 hours prior to the procedure and restarted immediately after the procedure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 1. Age>18 years
- 2. Subjects on chronic therapy with ACE-I and/or ARBs' (confirmed by electronic records in their medical file)
- 3. Subjects planned to undergo non-emergent coronary angiography.
- 4. Signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- 1. eGFR<30 ml/min at baseline
- 2. Chronic utilization of NSAIDS and Cox-2 selective inhibitors
- 3. Chronic treatment with mineralocorticosteroid receptor blocker
- 4. Systolic blood pressure<90 mmHg
- 5. Planned staged (repeated) procedure within 48 hours
- 6. Administration of contrast within 14 days prior to the enrollment
- 7. contraindication to stop ACE-I or ARB'S
